de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin
Class Annotation

java.lang.Object
  de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin.Annotation

public class Annotation
extends java.lang.Object

This class draws annotations on an Graphics2D Object.

Method Detail

setType

public void setType(int theType)
Set the type of annotation.

ANNOTATION_OFF = do not display any annotations.

ANNOTATION_FULL = display all possible annotation.

ANNOTATION_MINIMAL = displays only a minimal set of annotations.

ANNOTATION_ANONYMOUS = display all possible annotation, but the patients name.

ANNOTATION_PSEUDONYM = display all possible annotation, but uses a pseudonym for the patients name.

Parameters:
theType - the type of annotation.

getType

public int getType()
Gets the actual annotation type.

Returns:
the actual annotation type.

drawString

private void drawString(java.lang.String s,
                        int row,
                        int column,
                        int line)
Draws a string as annotation onto the BufferedImage stored in the local field image. The image is devided in 9 areas (3 rows, 3 columns). The string is placed at the position row/column at the given text line, starting with 1. The text is left/center/right justified depending on the position it is placed.

Parameters:
s - The string to draw.
row - The row of the area where the string should be drawn.
column - The column of the area where the string should be drawn.
line - The text line in the area where the string should be drawn.

createPseudonym

protected java.lang.String createPseudonym(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Creates a pseudonym for the patient: It is a 9 character long sting. The first character is the first character of the last name. The second is the first character of the given name or '_', if not present. The third character is allways '_'. The next 6 characters are the birth date of the patient in the foramt yymmdd.

Parameters:
ds - The Dataset to process.
Returns:
The pseudonym.

formatInteger

protected java.lang.String formatInteger(java.lang.String in,
                                         int n)
Formats a string representing a integer number. The resulting string has the given number of digits with leading '0'.

Parameters:
in - The string to process.
n - The number of digits.
Returns:
The formatted string.

formatDouble

protected java.lang.String formatDouble(java.lang.String in,
                                        int n)
Formats a string representing a floating point number. The resulting string has the given number of decimal places. The floating point number is roundet to that decimal places. If this decimal places is 0, the decimal point is also ommitted. If the input string is null or empty the returned string is the empty string.

Parameters:
in - The string to process.
n - The number of decimal places.
Returns:
The formatted string.

formatDate

public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.lang.String in)
Formats a string representing a date of the format yymmdd or yyyymmdd. The resulting string has the format yy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd.

Parameters:
in - The string to process.
Returns:
The formatted string.

formatTime

public static java.lang.String formatTime(java.lang.String in)
Formats a string representing a time of the format hhmmss.sss. The resulting string has the format hh:mm:ss.

Parameters:
in - The string to process.
Returns:
The formatted string.

string2LetterDigit

protected java.lang.String string2LetterDigit(java.lang.String s)
Formats a given string, that the resulting string only includes the characters 0..9, A..Z and a..z. Other characters are replaced by the '_'character.

Parameters:
s - The stringto foramt.
Returns:
The resulting string.
